Say you have a list of studies that you'd like to cite in a paper. It's important to check that none of these studies have been retracted, but manually going through a long list can take time. 

Here's how to check for retractions with a few lines of #Rstats code

[MINI-THREAD] https://t.co/felqVHIuni

Need a 3rd dimension in your #ggplot output?

Video attached of work-in-progress on {devoutrgl}. This is why I wanted {zstdlite}.

ggplot(mtcars) + geom_point3d(aes(mpg, wt, z = disp, size = disp, colour = as.factor(cyl)))
